activities.title: Climb the Tatras Mountains
activities.activity: For alpine diversions there's nowhere better than the Tatras, with the emerald-green glacial lake Morskie Oko.

activities.title: Delve into the Wieliczka Salt Mine
activities.activity: The spectacular Wieliczka Salt Mine, located just outside Kraków, features stunning bas-reliefs, chandeliers and a chapel sculpted from salt.

activities.title: Enter Lublin through the Cracow Gate
activities.activity: The primary entrance into the Old Town, the Cracow Gate, boasts impressive fortifications. It also houses a historical museum.

activities.title: Explore the old port city of Gdańsk
activities.activity: Gdańsk is home to the largest Gothic church in Poland and the Teutonic castles at Malbork and Gniew.

activities.title: Go hiking in Poland's nature reserves
activities.activity: There are few things more inspiring than a march through Poland’s diverse nature reserves, where you might spot lynx, wolf, wildcat and up to 120 brown bears.

activities.title: Go mushroom picking
activities.activity: Going for a long meandering walk in the woods to pick mushrooms can be a delightful experience, but make sure to go with an experienced mushrooms expert.

activities.title: Hit the beaches of the Pomeranian coast
activities.activity: Poland boasts some of the very best beaches in northern Europe, with ‘moving dunes’ which can shift several metres each year.

activities.title: Learn about the Holocaust at Auschwitz
activities.activity: The victims of the Holocaust are remembered at Oświęcim (Auschwitz), providing a poignant perspective on one of history's darkest periods.

activities.title: Learn about the resistance in the Warsaw Rising Museum
activities.activity: A walk through the Warsaw Rising Museum is an educational experience that highlights how Warsaw residents were active in the resistance.

activities.title: Sail your way through the Masurian Lake District
activities.activity: The Masurian Lake District, consisting of over 1,000 lakes, is a great place for sailing, as well as hosting sea-shanty festivals and other lively events.

activities.title: See the bison in Białowieża National Park
activities.activity: Białowieża National Park is the last major refuge of the European bison. Nature trails, cycling, and exploring with a ranger are on offer.

activities.title: Soak up the medieval vibes of Cracow
activities.activity: You'll immediately feel the charming medieval atmosphere in Cracow, with its stunning architecture and vibrant nightlife.

activities.title: Travel by horse-drawn sleigh
activities.activity: A horse-drawn sleigh ride is a magical experience, especially in the Tatras at Zakopane.

activities.title: Visit Warsaw's reconstructed Old Town
activities.activity: Although much of it was destroyed during World War II, Warsaw's Old Town has been carefully reconstructed, showcasing stunning architecture.

activities.title: Visit the Icon of the Black Madonna
activities.activity: The Icon of the Black Madonna, also known as the Madonna of Częstochowa, is housed in the Jasna Góra Monastery in Częstochowa.

activities.title: Visit the Old City of Zamość
activities.activity: The Renaissance-style market square in Zamość features architecture from Italian models of the 'ideal city'.

activities.title: Visit the house of Poland's greatest composer Chopin
activities.activity: The manor house where the famous Polish composer Frédéric Chopin was born contains instruments and furniture used by the great man.

activities.title: Wander the medieval town of Toruń
activities.activity: The medieval walled town of Toruń is one of Poland’s best-preserved examples of medieval architecture and is famous for its gingerbread.

activities.title: Wander the pretty town of Wrocław
activities.activity: Known as Breslau in German and long a part of the Prussian and then German empires, Wrocław is rich in history, especially around the cathedral on Ostrów Tumski (Cathedral Island).
